result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Re: Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
Preliminary Hearing on November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 10:43 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen in person. Defendant FAILS to appear, with Atty Julianne Lennon in person.
Date and time set for a preliminary hearing.
VRCW. 

ADA Coonen indicates there was not a writ complete, and Defendant is currently at Redgranite.
COURT questions time limits, they have been previously waived.
Atty Lennon indicates her client wishes to appear via Zoom for his next hearing.
Parties to schedule with JA., Deft may appear with Zoom. 

Adjourned: 10:44 a.m.

ADA Lacey Coonen appears in person; Atty Lennon appears in person
DATES remain

Pre-trial conference on September 29, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Preliminary Hearing on October 11, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on November 18, 2022 at 09:40 am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): Sud Shop Car Wash, or co-defendant: D.H.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. upon release within 5 business days.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 3:20 pm. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears via audio from Dodge Correctional, and with Attorney Peter Vu. 
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

COURT ORDERS: $2,000 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): Sud Shop Car Wash, or co-deft(s): D.H. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Prints and photograph upon release within 5 business days.
